title: The Voice judges have broken the show's rules after less than a month | Metro News
text:
Rebecca Lewis for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 8:48 pm The Voice judges bought Ciara back out (Picture: ITV) 
The Voice judges broke all the rules on Saturday night, demanding a hopeful who didn’t have a chair turn for her was bought back out so they could give her feedback. 
The show’s new twist means that the judges are not allowed to speak to any contestants who don’t wow them enough for a spot in their group, but after 18-year-old Ciara Harvie wowed the crowd with her performance of Pavarotti’s Nessun Dorma, will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Tom Jones, and Gavin Rossdale weren’t having any of that rule business. 
‘Did we make a mistake?’ Tom asked the crowd, who roundly replied that yes, they had all made a mistake as Ciara walked off stage during Saturday night’s episode. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video Tom realised they had made a mistake (Picture: ITV) 
‘I think so too,’ added will, before Gavin asked production crew if they could bring her back out. 
And when she walked back out, they were quick to tell her she had an incredible voice and to never give up on her dreams. Will had a sneak peek (Picture: ITV) 
‘You’re the only person we didn’t pick who we bought back out,’ said Gavin. 
‘We had to because we respect the voice. You have such a career ahead of you.’ 
‘You’re heading in the right direction,’ added Jennifer.
